title: Erdős #390: Factorial Factorization with Large Factors

problemStatement.formal: f(n) := \min\{m : n! = a_1 \cdots a_k, n < a_1 < \cdots < a_k = m\}. \text{ Is } f(n) - 2n \sim c \cdot n/\log n?
problemStatement.plain: Let f(n) be the minimal largest factor when writing n! as a product of distinct integers > n. Does (f(n) - 2n) · log n / n converge to a constant?
whyMatters: Secondary term behavior in asymptotic analysis

open: Does lim (f(n) - 2n) · log n / n exist?
If so, what is the constant c?
knownResults.goal: Determine whether limit exists and compute constant
